Discord is a great app for talking with people that share a common interest. It has a great GUI, an awesome dev team, and you can even voice chat with people! There's one catch to this amazing product though, it's not open sources! To most of you that might not seem like a lot, but to more hardcore fans of Linux, this might just be a deal breaker.

description: As this has been the only application I've really talked to my friends on since 2017, none of my opinions are really of the app itself, there's not much wrong with it that I can tell...but I'm really annoyed by the fact that I have to totally uninstall and reinstall the program for a lot of updates. I really do not think it's my lucky day today especially since I now cannot even uninstall my Discord how I normally could, but that may because I just upgraded my OS. This is really unfortunate and am struggling to find other ways to do it. I hope this is something that no longer exists in the future if possible, I don't entirely see the point of having us do that...

description: I really like the features it has and it's working well most of the time. The things I don't like is that you can't upload files that are more than 8MB in size unless you pay $5 per month and even if you do your limit will just be set to 50MB instead. There was also an animated emoji feature and animated avatar feature that you need the $5 subscription for but I'm okay with it as it's not very important to have. One thing that would be good is if we can be able to quote text. That's a very useful feature that discord doesn't have. Some things I love about it though is that it has syntax highlighting for code. You also have bots on some servers that can also be voiced in the voice channels and they can play music from YouTube.

Discord is great. I use it to chat with my friends all the time and it's always worked great for me. Except for one problem. They only provide a Debian binary and a tarball package. Where's the RPM for the Fedora, Red Hat, and openSUSE users? In order to install this on Fedora, I had to download something off of Github to build an RPM for me, which is going to be the case until Discord releases an official RPM package, or until distros come up with a standard universal binary.
summary: Discord is great, but needs RPM support

There are many, many problems with Discord. It is not encrypted, which means that they can very easily read your messages. It is nonfree software, which goes against the basic principles of why we have GNU/Linux to begin with, and it is outright Malware and Spyware. See https://stallman.org/discord.html for more info

Yeah, I like Discord. It can be a bit weird on rules for this, here, but not so much over there. Or worse, lax in one spot, and almost despotic tyrant elsewhere. While I DO think that some of that could depend on the group/ site/company that happens to be a fellow Discord user with a, "while you are under MY roof, mister...you do as I SAY!" Still, it seems like Discord could put more say in just how much say any individual discord site/spot has in that instance. They do not OWN that piece of Discord. Were that the case, it would be called Condo, or New York Apartments.

Discord may be marketed as just for gamers (and that's largely what I use it for: gaming), but there are servers for other interests as well. For example one for people who love reading or others for learning new languages and sharing your language with others (through voice chat or otherwise). It's also fun to sometimes listen to music with your friends or other people you meet using one of the many music bots. Bots are another thing that make Discord great with a lot of them having built-in games of sorts like trivia or pokemon. Video chat is another feature that it has and has been updated recently but I have not used it.

Die Idee für das Programm ist sehr gut, man kann es auf verschiedenen Plattformen nutzen. In letzter Zeit häufen sich die Sprachchat Probleme. Die Verbindungs-Qualität der verschiedenen europäischen Server ist meistens sehr schlecht. Auf Ubuntu kommt es meist bei der Verwendung von Firefox Facebook in Kombination mit Rhytembox zu starkem Kratzen. Erst ein mehrfacher Neustart von Discord eliminiert das Kratzen. In Windows reicht der wechsel der Sound Eingabe und Ausgabegeräte, das Discord kein Audio mehr überträgt. Man muss immer manuell die Eingabe und Ausgabegeräte einstellen. Eine automatische Erkennung der Gerade verwendeten Geräte wäre sinnvoll.

description:
Para los que les paso ahora que les aparece para descargar un paquete .deb, esta version la van a tener que desinstalar desde la tienda ya que desde el terminal no te la encuentra e instalar el paquete .deb que descargaron cuando lo abren, proceden asi:

1. Descargar el paquete.deb que indica discord en la carpeta Descargas
2. Abrir terminal (Ctrl+Alt+T)
3. Escribir sin comillas en el terminal 'cd Descargas'
4. Escriben en el terminal 'sudo dpkg -i discord-0.0.15.deb'
5. Les dira que no se puede instalar por que no se encontraron dependencias.
6. Escriben en el terminal 'sudo apt-get -f install' (descarga e instala dependencias anteriormente detectadas)
7. Vuelven a escribir en el terminal el paso 4 y listo.
La actualización nueva descargo el .deb y cada vez que instala y lo abro no me permite ingresar y me indica que debo volver a descargar e instalar.
Desde ayer sale una actualización requerida, no deja abrir el programa sin actualizarlo ni tampoco permite instalar la actualización.
summary: Pide una actualización y no deja ni instalarla ni abrir sin actualizar

Utilizo discord todos los dias, y la verdad esk funciona muy bien, es verdad que tiene sus bugs pero no son para tanto. Tenia problemas con la compartición de pantalla, ya que no se veia nada solo el raton. A quien le pase lo mismo y no sepa como solucionarlo aqui le dejo la solución:

Vamos a nuestros archivos raiz, acto segido entramos a "etc" y buscamos la carpeta "gdm3" una vez encontrada entramos en el archivo "custom.conf" con el editor de textos. En la 7 linea nos aparecera lo siguiente: # WaylandEnable=false LO UNICO QUE TENDREMOS QUE HACER ES QUITAR EL HASTAC "#" y despues de eso reiniciar. Una vez echo esto la compartición de pantalla de discord funcionara perfecto. Dejo la ruta para el que no se aclare con la explicacion de como llegar /etc/gdm3

Писал дистанционно экзамен по информатике. Посередине экзамена компьютер умер и не отвечал ни на что час. После перезагрузки нашёл в логах кучу сообщений об ошибке дискорда, хотя в момент экзамена дискордом я не пользовался. В итоге я не успел дописать экзамен и пошёл на пересдачу. Спасибо за стабильное и не мешающее приложение, как говориться.

Сегодня пришло обновление и никак не получалось обновиться из deb пакета. В общем решил проблему так:
1)Удалил через этот магазин приложений
2)Перезагрузил комп
3)Установил обновление через этот же магазин приложений
4)Готово

1. Во время видеосвязи жрёт 100% ресурсов процессора. А если включить аппаратное ускорение, то совсем всё тормозит. Из-за этого же дёргается звук.
 
2. Внезапное обновление не дает запустить Дискорд совсем. Чтоб у вас такие телефоны были, когда вместо экстренного звонка будете ждать пока не установится обновления на несколько десятков Мб!

3. Интерфейс неудобный, контакты не сыщешь. Последние разговоры не всплывают наверх.

Кадый раз при запуске выскакивает окно про установление обновления, сколько раз скачивала оба файла , ни один из них не работает. 
так же инструкции прочитанные ниже не работыют.
Пакет деб не поддерживается установщиком приложений, вручную - так же не устанавливается. Запуск без обновления - невозможен.....10 баллов из 10.
требует обновить программу, сколько раз скачал , не работает!!!
От души посмеялся с людей, которые не могут установить обновление
